content.title: Theoretical Probability
content.body:
The probability of an event \(P(E)\) is given by:

\[ P(E) = \frac{\text{Number of outcomes favorable to E}}{\text{Number of all possible outcomes}} \]

**Range:** The probability of an event is always between 0 and 1.

content.exactPhrase: The sum of the probability of an event and its complement (not E) is always 1. \(P(E) + P(\bar{E}) = 1\).
A sure event has a probability of 1. An impossible event has a probability of 0.

content.title: The 52 Playing Cards
content.body:
- **Total:** 52 cards (26 Red, 26 Black).
- **Suits:** 4 suits (Hearts, Diamonds, Spades, Clubs) - 13 cards each.
- **Face Cards:** 12 total (4 Kings, 4 Queens, 4 Jacks).
